MS_Acquisition.Parameters: FT full microscans=1 Ion trap MSn microscans=1 FT full max ion injection time=250 Ion trap MSn max ion injection time=100 FT full AGC target=1.00E+06 Ion trap MSn AGC target=5.00E+03 Acquire time=145 scan start time=15 Scan events=11 Scan range for event 1=400-1600 Data type for MS scan=profile Data type for MSn scan=centroid Lock mass IS enabled=no Repeat count=1 Repeat duration=10 Exclusion list size=500 Exclusion duration=45 Exclusion mass width (low)=5 ppm Exclusion mass width (high)=7.5 ppm Charge state screening enabled=yes Monoisotopic precursor=yes Non-peptide monoisotopic recognition enabled=no Charge state +1 rejected=yes Unassigned charge state rejected=yes Minimum MS signal threshold for MS2 trigger=3000 dissociation method=collision-induced dissociation Default charge state=2 Isolation width=2 m/z normalized collision energy=38 Activation Q=0.25 Activation time=10 ms

userParam.value: S. cerevisiae strain BY4741 (MATa, leu2Δ0, met15Δ0, ura3Δ0, his3Δ1) was grown in a 10-liter batch of rich (yeast extract peptone dextrose) medium at 30°C in a fermentor to an A600 of 0.93. After harvesting by continuous centrifugation, the cell pellet was washed three times with ice-cold water.
userParam.name: cell growth

userParam.value: The cells were lysed by incubation with 10% ice-cold trichloroacetic acid (v/v) final concentration for 1 h at 4°C. The protein precipitate was collected by centrifugation, washed twice with 90% ice-cold acetone, and pelleted again. The resulting material was aliquotted, lyophilized and stored at -80°C.
userParam.name: cell lysis and sample storage

cvParam.value: Lyophilized yeast lysate (1 mg) was reconstituted in 8 M urea, 10 mM DTT in 50 mM NH4HCO3, and incubated for 45 min. Then, cysteine residues were alkylated with 30 mM iodoacetamide (final concentration) for 30 min. Prior to trypsinization, an additional volume of 50 mM ammonium bicarbonate was added to the sample to reduce the urea concentration to 1 M. A total of 50 μg of trypsin was added to sample and incubated overnight (16 h) at 32°C with gentle swirling. After digestion, formic acid was added to a final concentration of 0.5%, and desalted with C18 (SepPak, Waters) according to manufacturer’s recommendations. Finally, aliquots of 50 μg of yeast-digested protein sample was prepared, lyophilized to dryness and mailed to study participants. All samples were delivered to the participant laboratories in dry-ice within 36 hours.
cvParam.name: sample preparation

cvParam.value: LC system=nanoAcquity UPLC (Waters) Autosampler temperature=10 ºC Column dimensions=(1) BEH130 C18 1.7um, 0.075x100mm (2) BEH130 C18 1.7um, 0.075x250mm (3) BEH130 C18 1.7um, 0.075x100mm Precolumn dimensions=Symmetry C18, 0.180x20mm Column temperature=32 ºC Mobile phase A=0.1% Formic Acid (FA) Mobile phase B=0.1% FA in Acetonitrile Injection mode=full-loop Injection volume (or loop size)=6.5 microlitter Flow rate for gradient=250 nL/min Separation gradient=2 - 30% B in 110 min.
cvParam.name: liquid chromatography
